tests.name: Fast hard tapping
tests.preconditions: Tester has set (1) the PushTracker E2 in tap training mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Tap forcefully 20 times in 30 seconds on a hard surface, e.g., handrim.
Tap forcefully 20 times in 30 seconds on a soft surface, e.g., thigh.
acceptanceCriteria: The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.
The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.

tests.name: Fast soft tapping
tests.preconditions: Tester has set (1) the PushTracker E2 in tap training mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Tap softly 20 times in 30 seconds on a hard surface, e.g., handrim.
Tap softly 20 times in 30 seconds on a soft surface, e.g., thigh.
acceptanceCriteria: The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.
The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.

tests.name: Slow hard tapping
tests.preconditions: Tester has set (1) the PushTracker E2 in tap training mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Tap forcefully 20 times in 60 seconds on a hard surface, e.g., handrim.
Tap forcefully 20 times in 60 seconds on a soft surface, e.g., thigh.
acceptanceCriteria: The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.
The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.

tests.name: Slow soft tapping
tests.preconditions: Tester has set (1) the PushTracker E2 in tap training mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Tap softly 20 times in 60 seconds on a hard surface, e.g., handrim.
Tap softly 20 times in 60 seconds on a soft surface, e.g., thigh.
acceptanceCriteria: The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.
The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.

tests.name: Left-hand sideways tapping
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on the left hand, seated on a manual wheelchair, and set (1) the PushTracker E2 in tap training mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Tap 20 times sideways into the wheelchair handrim
Tap 20 times vertically onto the wheelchair tire
acceptanceCriteria: The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.
The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.

tests.name: Right-hand sideways tapping
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on the right hand, seated on a manual wheelchair, and set (1) the PushTracker E2 in tap training mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Tap 20 times sideways into the wheelchair handrim
Tap 20 times vertically onto the wheelchair tire
acceptanceCriteria: The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.
The PushTracker E2 must vibrate 20 times and flash red for each detected tap.

tests.name: Double tap on handrim
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, seated on a manual wheelchair that is equipped with a SmartDrive and set (1) the PushTracker E2 in power-assist mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Start in stationary position and double tap on handrim
acceptanceCriteria: The SmartDrive motor should activate and initiate ramping process. The SmartDrive should ramp to its max-speed setting.

tests.name: Tap continuously on handrim
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, seated on a manual wheelchair that is equipped with a SmartDrive and set (1) the PushTracker E2 in power-assist mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Start in stationary position and tap continuously on handrim
acceptanceCriteria: The SmartDrive motor should not activate.

tests.name: Perform normal, common hand movements
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, seated on a manual wheelchair that is equipped with a SmartDrive and set (1) the PushTracker E2 in power-assist mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Start in stationary position and move hands normally, e.g., typing, talking to people
acceptanceCriteria: The SmartDrive motor should not activate.

tests.name: Pushing on indoor/outdoor surfaces such as carpets, sidewalks, etc.
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, seated on a manual wheelchair that is equipped with a SmartDrive and set (1) the PushTracker E2 in power-assist mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Start in stationary position push wheelchair in indoor and outdoor ground surfaces e.g., carpets, sidewalks
acceptanceCriteria: The SmartDrive motor should not activate.

tests.name: Tap continuously on handrim
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, seated on a manual wheelchair that is equipped with a SmartDrive and set (1) the PushTracker E2 in power-assist mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Start the SmartDrive motor and get into motion. Tap continuously on handrim
acceptanceCriteria: The SmartDrive motor should deactivate and stop.

tests.name: Keep hands on handrim while traveling on indoor and outdoor ground surfaces, e.g., carpets, sidewalks, etc.
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, seated on a manual wheelchair that is equipped with a SmartDrive and set (1) the PushTracker E2 in power-assist mode and set (2) the default tap sensitivity is set to 70%.
methods: Start the SmartDrive motor and get into motion. Holds hand on handrim while moving.
acceptanceCriteria: The SmartDrive motor should not deactivate.

reports.description: Equivalence Tests compared against v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app.

tests.name: Tap Detection Accuracy compared against v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app for System Version PWDR.190618.001.A1
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, and set the PushTracker E2 in tap-training mode. The PushTracker E2 must use system version PWDR.190618.001.A1.
methods: Set the tap sensitivity to 10% and tap 20 times using v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app. Repeat this test using the current version of the SmartDrive Wear OS app.
Set the tap sensitivity to 70% and tap 20 times using v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app. Repeat this test using the current version of the SmartDrive Wear OS app.
Set the tap sensitivity to 100% and tap 20 times using v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app. Repeat this test using the current version of the SmartDrive Wear OS app.
acceptanceCriteria: The number of detected taps between the software versions should differ by no more than 5%, e.g., 19 taps using v1.0.00 and 20 taps using current version or vice versa.
The number of detected taps between the software versions should differ by no more than 5%, e.g., 19 taps using v1.0.00 and 20 taps using current version or vice versa.
The number of detected taps between the software versions should differ by no more than 5%, e.g., 19 taps using v1.0.00 and 20 taps using current version or vice versa.

tests.name: Tap Detection Accuracy compared against v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app for System Version OWDT.181031.001
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, and set the PushTracker E2 in tap-training mode. The PushTracker E2 must use system version OWDT.181031.001.
methods: Set the tap sensitivity to 10% and tap 20 times using v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app. Repeat this test using the current version of the SmartDrive Wear OS app.
Set the tap sensitivity to 70% and tap 20 times using v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app. Repeat this test using the current version of the SmartDrive Wear OS app.
Set the tap sensitivity to 100% and tap 20 times using v1.0.00 of the SmartDrive Wear OS app. Repeat this test using the current version of the SmartDrive Wear OS app.
acceptanceCriteria: The number of detected taps between the software versions should differ by no more than 5%, e.g., 19 taps using v1.0.00 and 20 taps using current version or vice versa.
The number of detected taps between the software versions should differ by no more than 5%, e.g., 19 taps using v1.0.00 and 20 taps using current version or vice versa.
The number of detected taps between the software versions should differ by no more than 5%, e.g., 19 taps using v1.0.00 and 20 taps using current version or vice versa.

reports.description: Equivalence Tests compared against the original PushTracker.

tests.name: Tap Detection Accuracy compared against the original PushTracker
tests.preconditions: Tester has worn the PushTracker E2 on their primary hand, and set the PushTracker E2 in tap-training mode. Use default tap sensitivity of 70% on the PushTracker E2 and a default tap sensivitiy of 100% on the original PushTracker for this test.
methods: Tap 20 times using the current version of the SmartDrive Wear OS app on the PushTracker E2. Repeat this test using the original PushTracker.
acceptanceCriteria: The number of detected taps between the two systems should differ by no more than 5%, e.g., 19 taps using PushTracker E2 and 20 taps using the original PushTracker or vice versa.
